Circular references in formulas

A formula cannot contain a circular reference.

For example:

HR = [PULSE]

PULSE = IF ( [HR] > 80, [HR], [HR] ^ 1.02 )

The first expression uses Pulse to obtain Heart Rate. The second expression uses Heart Rate to obtain Pulse. Neither of the expressions can be calculated.

A circular reference can involve more than two expressions:

A = 2 * B

B = 3 * C

C = 4 * A

The first expression uses B to obtain A. The second expression uses C to obtain B. The third expression uses C to obtain A. None of these expressions can be calculated.
